feature: Implement virtual scrolling for long lists in Scout and Cities panels
description: The ScoutPanel displays lists of cities grouped by country, and CityInfoPanel can show many nearby places/attractions. Large lists force the browser to render all DOM nodes even when only a fraction are visible. This implementation adds virtualization to improve performance.

phases.name: Create Reusable Virtual List Hook
phases.description: Create a flexible useVirtualList hook that can handle both fixed and variable height items, and integrate with existing scroll containers

subtasks.title: Create useVirtualList hook
subtasks.description: Create a custom hook in src/hooks/useVirtualList.ts that calculates visible items based on scroll position, container height, and item heights. Should support: fixed heights, variable heights via estimator function, overscan for smooth scrolling, and scroll restoration.
acceptance_criteria: Hook accepts items array, container ref, and item height config
Returns visible items slice with start/end indices
Supports both fixed and variable height modes
subtasks.notes: Created useVirtualList hook at src/hooks/useVirtualList.ts with: fixed/variable height support, binary search for efficient start index calculation, overscan (default 5), ResizeObserver for resize handling, scroll restoration via initialScrollTop and scrollToIndex, height caching for variable heights, and minItemsForVirtualization option.

subtasks.title: Create VirtualListContainer component
subtasks.description: Create a reusable VirtualListContainer component that wraps children with proper absolute positioning and total height calculation. Works with the useVirtualList hook.
acceptance_criteria: Renders spacer div for total scroll height
Works with both desktop and mobile scroll contexts
subtasks.notes: Created VirtualListContainer component at src/components/ui/virtual-list-container.tsx. Component provides: spacer div with totalHeight for scroll sizing, absolute positioning for children, className/innerClassName props for styling flexibility, and works with both desktop and mobile scroll contexts. Also added VirtualListItem helper component.

phases.name: Virtualize ScoutPanel Top Locations View
phases.description: Apply virtual scrolling to the flat list of ranked cities in ScoutPanel's 'Top Locations' view mode

subtasks.title: Measure and standardize location card heights
subtasks.description: Audit RankedLocationCard, OverallLocationCard, BlurredRankedCard, and BlurredOverallCard components to determine fixed heights or create height estimator. Cards need consistent heights for efficient virtualization.
acceptance_criteria: Document measured heights for each card type
Ensure cards have fixed heights (avoid content-dependent sizing)
subtasks.notes: Created scout-panel-heights.ts with measured heights for all card types: BlurredRankedCard (130px), BlurredOverallCard (130px), RankedLocationCard (130px base / 170px with expand button), OverallLocationCard (136px base / 176px with expand button), SignUpPromptCard (200px). Also includes list spacing constants (12px gap, 16px padding), pre-calculated item heights with gaps, height estimator functions, and virtualization config.

subtasks.title: Implement virtual scrolling for Overall Top Locations
subtasks.description: Refactor the Overall view's Top Locations list (filteredOverallLocations.map) to use virtual scrolling. This is the list at lines 777-784 in ScoutPanel.tsx.
acceptance_criteria: Only visible OverallLocationCard items are rendered
SignUpPromptCard and BlurredOverallCard items handled correctly at top
Click handlers work correctly on virtualized items
subtasks.notes: Implemented virtual scrolling for Overall Top Locations list. Created OverallVirtualItem discriminated union type for handling mixed card types (SignUpPromptCard, BlurredOverallCard, OverallLocationCard). Added getOverallVirtualItemHeight function for variable height support. Created overallVirtualItems useMemo that builds the combined list considering authentication state. Used useVirtualList hook with variable height estimator and replaced static .map() rendering with VirtualListContainer. Added scroll container ref (overallTopScrollRef) for proper virtualization tracking.

subtasks.title: Implement virtual scrolling for Category Top Locations
subtasks.description: Refactor the Category view's Top Locations list (topLocations.map) to use virtual scrolling. This is the list at lines 856-864 in ScoutPanel.tsx.
acceptance_criteria: Only visible RankedLocationCard items are rendered
Category switching doesn't break scroll position
subtasks.notes: Implemented virtual scrolling for Category Top Locations list. Created CategoryVirtualItem discriminated union type for handling mixed card types (SignUpPromptCard, BlurredRankedCard, RankedLocationCard). Added getCategoryVirtualItemHeight function for variable height support. Created categoryVirtualItems useMemo that builds the combined list considering authentication state. Used useVirtualList hook with variable height estimator and replaced static .map() rendering with VirtualListContainer. Added scroll container ref (categoryTopScrollRef) for proper virtualization tracking.

phases.name: Virtualize ScoutPanel Countries View
phases.description: Apply virtual scrolling to the collapsible country sections in ScoutPanel's 'Countries' view mode

subtasks.title: Measure country section component heights
subtasks.description: Audit CountrySection and OverallCountrySection components to determine collapsed and expanded heights. Expanded sections contain nested city cards.
acceptance_criteria: Document expanded calculation (header + n * card height)
Create height calculator function for sections
subtasks.notes: Audited CountrySection and OverallCountrySection components. Added to scout-panel-heights.ts: COUNTRY_SECTION_HEADER_HEIGHT (56px) for collapsed header, LOCATION_CARD_BASE_HEIGHT (130px) and LOCATION_CARD_WITH_EXPAND_HEIGHT (170px) for nested cards, padding constants (pt-1=4px, pb-4=16px, space-y-2=8px gap), and height calculator functions: getCountrySectionExpandedHeight(), getOverallCountrySectionExpandedHeight(), and getCountrySectionHeight(). Also added COUNTRY_SECTION_VIRTUALIZATION_CONFIG with recommended overscan of 2.

subtasks.title: Implement virtual scrolling for Overall Countries view
subtasks.description: Refactor the overallCountryGroups.map at lines 805-814 to use virtualization. Must handle dynamic heights as sections expand/collapse.
acceptance_criteria: Height recalculates on expansion state change
subtasks.notes: Implemented virtual scrolling for Overall Countries view. Added OverallCountryVirtualItem type and getOverallCountryVirtualItemHeight function for dynamic height calculation based on expansion state. Created overallCountryVirtualItems useMemo that includes expansion state for each country section. Used useVirtualList hook with COUNTRY_SECTION_VIRTUALIZATION_CONFIG (overscan: 2, minItemsForVirtualization: 5). Replaced static overallCountryGroups.map() with VirtualListContainer for virtualized rendering.

subtasks.title: Implement virtual scrolling for Category Countries view
subtasks.description: Refactor the displayCountries.map at lines 885-895 to use virtualization. Similar to Overall countries but with different data structure.
acceptance_criteria: onShowMarkers callback works with virtualized list
subtasks.notes: Implemented virtual scrolling for Category Countries view. Added categoryCountriesScrollRef for scroll container tracking, created categoryCountryVirtualItems useMemo with expansion state for each country section, set up useVirtualList hook with COUNTRY_SECTION_VIRTUALIZATION_CONFIG (overscan: 2, minItemsForVirtualization: 5), and replaced static displayCountries.map() with VirtualListContainer for virtualized rendering. Follows same pattern as Overall Countries virtualization.

phases.name: Virtualize PlacesTab in CityInfoPanel
phases.description: Apply virtual scrolling to the places list in CityInfoPanel's PlacesTab component

subtasks.title: Measure PlaceCard component height
subtasks.description: Audit PlaceCard component to determine fixed height. Cards have photo, title, rating, badges - need consistent sizing.
acceptance_criteria: Ensure consistent card height regardless of content
subtasks.notes: Audited PlaceCard component structure. Created places-tab-heights.ts with height constants: PLACE_CARD_HEIGHT (104px), PLACE_CARD_GAP (12px), PLACE_CARD_ITEM_HEIGHT (116px). PlaceCard has fixed structure: 80px photo (w-20 h-20), up to 86px info section (title + rating + distance + badge), with 8px padding (p-2). Using 104px for virtualization to ensure all content fits with 2px buffer.

subtasks.title: Implement virtual scrolling for PlacesTab
subtasks.description: Refactor the places.map at line 105 in PlacesTab.tsx to use virtual scrolling. Container is the tab content scroll area.
acceptance_criteria: Loading skeleton shows correct number of items
Works in both desktop panel and mobile sheet contexts

phases.name: Testing and Optimization
phases.description: Test virtualization across all components, optimize performance, and handle edge cases

subtasks.title: Performance testing with large datasets
subtasks.description: Test all virtualized lists with 200+ items. Measure frame rate, memory usage, and scroll responsiveness. Compare before/after metrics.

subtasks.title: Mobile testing and touch optimization
subtasks.description: Test virtualization in mobile bottom sheets. Ensure touch scrolling, momentum, and overscroll behavior work correctly.
acceptance_criteria: No jank on iOS Safari and Android Chrome

subtasks.title: Edge case handling
subtasks.description: Handle edge cases: empty lists, single item, rapid filter changes, window resize, tab switching, orientation changes.
acceptance_criteria: Filter changes don't cause scroll jumps
Tab switching preserves reasonable scroll state

final_acceptance: ScoutPanel Top Locations view renders only visible items (verified via React DevTools)
ScoutPanel Countries view renders only visible country sections
PlacesTab renders only visible place cards
All lists maintain 60fps scroll performance with 200+ items
Mobile bottom sheets work correctly with virtualization
No visual regressions in any list UI
TypeScript compilation passes with no errors
Build succeeds without warnings related to virtualization

Mobile sheets have their own scroll containers
